snippet: The Supreme Court turned down a challenge to a law that allows judges in Alabama to send a defendant to death row despite a jury’s recommendation of life in prison.
abstract: Supreme Court turns down challenge to unusual Alabama capital-sentencing practice that allows judges to override determinations from juries calling for leniency; practice has sent 95 defendants to death row despite jury determinations calling for life sentences.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court turned down a challenge to a law that allows judges in Alabama to send a defendant to death row despite a jury’s recommendation of life in prison.

headline.main: Alabama Judges Retain the Right to Override Juries in Capital Sentencing
headline.print_headline: Judges in Alabama Retain the Right to Override Their Juries in Capital Sentencing
